newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's CVRD, China Steel in supply pact.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's CVRD, China Steel in supply pact.

text.p: Brazil's state-owned Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) reached an agreement to supply 1.8 million tonnes of iron ore a year to China Steel of Taiwan, CVRD said on Tuesday.
The 10-year contract, signed Monday in Taiwan, represents a 28.6 percent increase on the amount of ore supplied under an existing agreement, which dates from 1979, CVRD said in a statement.
Because China Steel normally requires more ore than stipulated in the contract, CVRD expects the actual tonnage shipped this year to exceed two million tonnes.

CVRD is the world's largest iron ore exporter and a major producer of most metals. A 45 percent block of voting shares in the company is being auctioned on April 29 for three billion reais ($2.83 billion).
